result.execSummary:
The defendant Dylan Cole Drabek was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Armed Robbery, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program.
Credit of 136 days served.

superMiscConds.notes:
Restitution of $12,192.00 to be paid to Lucia L. and $5,000.00 to Wilson Insurance. Restitution hearing set for 12/03/2014 @ 1:30pm.

AMENDED ON 12/19/2014: $12,192.65 to be paid as follows: $7,192.65 to Lucia L. and $5,000.00 to Wilson Insurance.

Court Costs and DNA surcharge to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision.

If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

No contact with the victim, family, residence, business or place of employment.
Maintain absolute sobriety.
Attend Criminal Thinking course.
Job skills readiness program.
Attend support meetings twice a week.
Complete Compass Assessment program.
Follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent.
Provide DNA sample if not already provided.

Defendant Dylan Cole Drabek in court, in custody, with attorney Michael j Backes.   Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case called for motion for resentencing. Defense advises this is a postconviction motion with respect to the sentence. State responds. Court will proceed with testimony. Luann A. from Dept. of Corrections sworn and testified.  Attorney Tony R. sworn and testified. Testimony is closed. Defense presents arguments. State presents arguments. Court denies the motion in it's entirety.

Defendant Dylan Cole Drabek in court, in custody, with attorney J Anthony Rosario.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Parties proceed to sentencing on Ct. 1.  Defense requests the court set a restitution hearing. Court will set a restitution hearing within 60 days.  

Court orders the following: 
Ct. 1:
- Total sentence: 17 years (Initial Confinement: 10 years - 136 days credit, Extended Supervision: 7 years)  
- Defendant IS NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration 
- Defendant IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program. 
- Court Costs totaling $278.00 (includes DRGOD) to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision. 
- Restitution totaling $12,192.00 to be paid to Lucia L. and $5,000.00 to be paid to Wilson Insurance - to be set for a restitution hearing.
- DNA Surcharge totaling $250.00 to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision.
- Conditions of Extended Supervision: No contact with the victim, family, residence or business - employment. Maintain absolute sobriety. Criminal thinking course. Job skills readiness program. Support meetings 2 times per week. Complete Compass assessment program.  Follow thru with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent.  DNA Sample if not yet provided. 

  Restitution hearing scheduled for December 3, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Sentencing hearing on October 16, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Dylan Cole Drabek in court, in custody, with attorney J Anthony Rosario.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant does not contest the doctor's report.  Mr. Drabek is requesting that Attorney Rosario remain as counsel. Defense counsel presents bail arguments. State objects to any bail modification. Court denied the motion and bail remains as fixed.   Preliminary Hearing requested within 10 days.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 23, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Dylan Cole Drabek in court, in custody, with attorney J Anthony Rosario.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern by Sam Wegleitner appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Competency evaluation has been completed. Atty. Rosario was unable to discuss the evaluation with Mr. Drabek and defendant has not seen the evaluation yet. Statements presented by Mr. Drabek. Court reviewed the competency evaluation. Atty. Rosario requests an adjournment to talk to the defendant.   Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for July 14, 2014 at 01:15 pm.
from Dr. John Pankiewicz, M.D. from Wisconsin Forensic Unit
Motion to Modify Bail-filed by defendant-Jail Inmate Communication Form
Hearing on July 11, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
for competency examination pursuant to Section 971.14(2), Wisconsin Statue, to be done by Wisconsin Forensic Unit

Defendant Dylan Cole Drabek in court, in custody, with attorney J A Rosario.   Andrea M Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense Counsel requests order for competency pursuant to Sec. 971.14(2).  State does not object.  Court finds probable cause.  Court grants request and orders the defendant be examined by the Wisconsin Forensic Unit.  To be done as an inpatient/outpatient basis within 15 days.  Defendant moves to modify bail.  State objects to any modification of bail.  Court declines the bail modification motion.  Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for July 11, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
Motion to Modify Bail filed by defendant-Jail inmate communication form.
Preliminary hearing on June 25, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
